individual_metadata.synopsis: The player encounters a pack of winged ghouls on Moonrise's upper exterior. They are disgusting undead who are eternally starving for dead and rotting flesh. Though intelligent, they can be near feral in their need to feed.In this case, the player meets a still-intelligent one with two less-bright comrades. The leader challenges the player, saying the cult has promised them plenty of meat but they've received none. Instead, the corpses are dropped below the tower (unbeknownst to them, to be fed to the Elder Brain or used in the Necromancer's experiments)
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: |Walk close enough to the ghouls and this will automatically trigger. If 'Main' ghoul is dead, will start a fight instead.|

AD_Hungry.synopsis: There are three winged ghouls on the upper exterior of Moonrise. They are slightly more intellegent then the wingless ghouls near the Moonrise entrance and the two groups have beef with eachother, They crave fresh meat and don't think much of anything else.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Both sessions describe encounters with winged ghouls at Moonrise’s upper exterior but appear to represent alternative outcomes rather than a continuous sequence. The unnamed session details a scenario with a pack led by an intelligent ghoul confronting the player about missing meat—hinting at a specific plot point regarding corpses being used elsewhere. In contrast, 'AD_Hungry' presents an encounter with three winged ghouls that have a beef with another group, implying a different set of circumstances in the same area. Because these sessions are triggered under different conditions and seem to offer mutually exclusive versions of the encounter (one replacing the other based on game progression details), they should not both appear on the same playthrough. There are no clear cause–effect or sequential dependencies established between them.

45.speaker: Winged Horror
45.context: NodeContext: Feral, starving - catching player's scent

28.speaker: Winged Horror
28.context: NodeContext: Feral, starving - catching player's scent

4.speaker: Winged Horror
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Throwing up a hand to silence her comrades to either sideNodeContext: Silencing her comrades, turning to speak to player head-on

2.speaker: Winged Horror
2.text: We hunger, True Soul. The Absolute promised us a feast of corpses, and still we starve!
2.context: NodeContext: Just as starving and feral as her companions, but a better grip on herself.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: I have something in my pack, if you'd like?

32.speaker: Winged Horror
32.text: Scraps! The real feast is below. They drop corpses down into the tunnels - enough to feed an army of us.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Sorry. Fresh out of rotting flesh.

14.speaker: Winged Horror
14.text: Liar! They drop corpses beneath the tower. Some beast in the tunnels gets fat, while we go hungry!

7.speaker: Player
7.text: The Absolute owes you nothing. You owe Her your faith.

23.speaker: Winged Horror
23.text: She had it - until She kept the real feast from us!

27.speaker: Player
27.text: I honestly didn't know your kind could string a sentence together.

21.speaker: Winged Horror
21.text: The ones below are kept starving and stupid. But not I - I know where the real feast is.

6.speaker: Winged Horror
6.text: They drop corpses down into the tunnels below the tower. Enough to feed an army of us!

33.speaker: Winged Horror
33.text: If the Absolute will not share Her dead flesh... we will tear it from the backs of the living.
33.context: NodeContext: Shifting to a hostile tone, threatening us

5.speaker: Narrator
5.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

42.speaker: Narrator
42.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Symbol on NPC glowsInternalNodeContext: Delete if you are talking to a companion.

43.speaker: Narrator
43.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Have patience. There's a lot of flesh waiting in Baldur's Gate.

10.speaker: Winged Horror
10.text: Yes... so much flesh. A mountain of it... Fine.
10.context: NodeContext: Considering - greed winning out as she opts to be patient with us... this time.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: I've never eaten ghoul before. For you, I might make an exception.

1.speaker: Winged Horror
1.text: You... would not. Could not. I...
1.context: NodeContext: Taken aback, wants to stand up to us but genuinely rattled by our threat

30.speaker: Winged Horror
30.text: We will wait, True Soul. But only a little longer. Come!
30.context: NodeContext: Last line shouted over shoulder to companions (they fly away immediately after dialogue)

19.speaker: Winged Horror
19.text: Enough. I wish to taste True Soul. FEED!
19.context: NodeContext: Done listening to us. Last line is finally letting her feral side out as she calls on her companions to rip us apart

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Your friends seem faithful enough. So they may start by feeding on your flesh.

17.speaker: Winged Horror
17.text: But you... you look so much juicier. FEED!
17.context: NodeContext: Has the scent of our blood now, won't be put off by threats. Last line is finally letting her feral side out as she orders her companions to attack us.

46.speaker: Narrator
46.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

13.speaker: Narrator
13.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

12.speaker: Narrator
12.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

3.speaker: Winged Horror
3.context: NodeContext: Confident, but immediately cut off as her comrades betray her

36.speaker: Winged Horror
36.context: NodeContext: Harsh, raucous - immediately betraying friend even as that friend claims they'll stand together

24.speaker: Winged Horror
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cowering, flies away immediately after dialogueNodeContext: Flinching, frightened (flies away immediately afterwards, chased by friends)

44.speaker: Narrator
44.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

48.speaker: Narrator
48.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

25.speaker: Narrator
25.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

35.speaker: Narrator
35.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Your friends seem faithful enough. So they may start by feeding on your flesh.

16.speaker: Winged Horror
16.text: No. You do not stink as much as we like... but you will do. FEED!
16.context: NodeContext: Preventing us leaving. Finally line is her initiating an attack (and ordering her two companions to do the same.

AD_Hungry_6.speaker: Winged Horror
AD_Hungry_6.text: NO! Not again - my flesh still stings from her claws!

AD_Hungry_4.speaker: Winged Horror
AD_Hungry_4.text: A great hunter. To be feeaared.

AD_Hungry_5.speaker: Winged Horror
AD_Hungry_5.text: Do you smell it, siblings? The meat below the tower?!

AD_Hungry_9.speaker: Winged Horror
AD_Hungry_9.text: So much. And not all dead. It smells...

AD_Hungry_1.speaker: Winged Horror
AD_Hungry_1.text: But... it is all full of little bones.

AD_Hungry_3.speaker: Winged Horror
AD_Hungry_3.text: Yes, good crunch! And sooo salty, too.
